intro: Lebeckia schlechteriana, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Lebeckia schlechteriana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
